text: Hi Jafar, give me a nudge when you're ready
Hi oliver im ready
Good stuff
I've had a look at your CV
and from your experience it looks very much like you're looking to break into working on set
but you definitely want to go down the VFX route correct?
pretty much
and yeah i've always been intrigued with vfx
right okay cool
also find that vfx companies give me more of an opportunity to interview at their companies
First thing I noticed is that you are playing on the TV runner part of your experience quite a lot
even though im not successful
What you will find is that post houses generally only want to give their runner positions to people who show that they are super keen in VFX
aye
What role is it you want in a post house, as in what's your dream job?
i was thinking of editing as i thought they had people doing that
but then i started looking at compositing quite a bit
which i'm trying to teach myself a bit more on
This got me when I started out
so im sort of leaning towards the 2d side?
if you're looking at your traditional Post Houses, generally they are VFX
They do have editorial but it tends to be a stepping stone onto another role (sometimes colouring)
i always thought that
Have you done any compositing before?
ahh colour grading
i've never done it before hand
i mean i dont know if u count major project as that
Right okay
on premier pro
What would you say your best skillset was at uni? What did your colleagues rope you in to do mainly?
the ability to adapt
premier pro isn't comp i'm afraid. It's Nuke as standard in the industry
yeah gathered that nuke was
So would you be working in production? Maybe a producer for your uni projects?
yeah mostly
sometimes VT Op/ VT editor
never learnt graphics which annoyed me but now im teaching myself more
Have you applied to places like Envy before?
I've always looked at them
but always thought they'd never look at me
for post
i've tried molianare i think its called
Reason I say is that they do do a lot of editing for TV
But also have a Nuke department
That would be the sort of place you should consider applying too.
ahh i shall give them a look
You would need to start as a runner but I absolutely love running
is nuke free?
loved*
you can download the non-commercial lisence
It's pretty scary and not very intuitive when you first get started
being a runner is the most underappreciated job but i loved my time at x-factor doing so
i'll give that a download
You'd be surprised
studios do run with out runners
In post, it is a lot different
but the barriers you will come across are mainly going to be that you don't have a specific specialism
what do post runners do?
have you thought about working as a producer?
uni never taught me much on that
i have done
Post runners look after clients, the building, running hard drives around town
ahh
If you are organised production is a great department to work in
you don't need the artistic talent
it's much more about your managerial skills as well as your organisation
plus, it does tend to lead on to higher salaries
so what do you do in Escape studios? did you start off as a runner?
Escape Studios is a VFX, Games and Animation School. I'm actually the Head of Sales (don't worry I won't sell you anything)
But I started out as a camera operator
and then went into The Mill as a production runner
then back to camera work before throwing the towel in and getting a lovely desk job at Escape Studios :slightly_smiling_face:
ooo The mill i heard they are hard to get into
They can be
did you enjoy being a camera op?
but I went to my interview knowing I wanted to work in Production there
I did, it's great when you have the work
but it's not constant. I do much prefer post production because of that. You get a salary in most places
damn thats awesome
Hah
haha
It's not really dude. I know exactly where your coming from and where you're at now looking for work
You can get a job
i know i can
but half the time the responses are demeaning
which i get
One of the biggest lessons I learnt in the creative industries is learning to deal with rejection and to not let it put a dampener on your aspirations
because im new
how did you do that?
It is difficult
but even when you get your first job, you will still be shot down for your ideas. Learning to deal with that really gets you to listen to feedback so you can make the  next step up
For me, it was to take seniors literally and do my best to improve on their feedback for next time
aye thats true
did you ever find the jobs degrading?
In all honesty, it's the exact same situation if you were an apprentice for a builder
you are going to get all of the crap jobs to start with
no, never
even then i dont mind haha
Junior roles in any industry are going to be difficult
yeah i've never applied to those roles
i always thought it was for those who were running for a couple of years
trying to get a foot up
There will always be situations where you think you can be more efficient than a senior but you keep your mouth shut and listen to the person with experience
honestly, you'll be surprised how much you learn
I'm including running in junior roles really
but you would need to be a pro with the software and have a decent showreel to go in straight away as a junior
not a lot of studios are hiring juniors outside of their facilities either
true
i learnt that the hard way
:rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
i only applied once i graduated
haha
got no response then a month later
me too!
it's quite funny
the producer replied back
Don't be afraid to apply to companies more than once
you should have a diary for all of the studios you are wanting to apply to
see that i can do
i have an excel
sheet
and every 2 months, apply again with an updated CV
So
Lets sort out some actions, and we can then catch up again next week
how do you update your cv if your not working at the moment?
(I have about another 15 minutes)
It's more tailoring it
can you still put softwares you've learned
But anyway
for next week. I want you to do some research and look at the VFX Pipeline
aye i shall
This is one of my favourite blogs
<http://www.andrew-whitehurst.net/pipeline.html>
i watch the same guy
Take a look at all of the different roles and see what it is you want to do
Also, take a look at producing too :slightly_smiling_face:
i shall
I think once you have a clear idea of the job you want in the long run, it will make it much easier to then pull your CV apart and put it back together
I'll be back in just a sec
i watch a lot of allan mckay
He's great
he helped me with my first interview
for union vfx
Ah really! That's great
did you get any feedback from Union?
i smashed it but i spoke with the head recruiter

Grace and I thought you came across well and seemed friendly and approachable which is always important for a Running role.
We both agreed that you need a bit more motivation to get into the industry, this is why I suggested getting in touch with Soho Runners to boost your experience and exposure to the industry.
I can appreciate that it can be frustrating when you keep applying with for roles with no success, but dont be put off by this. Use it to push yourself and build that determination to get experience.
Id also like to point you in the direct of Access:
and gave me access vfx's website
okay cool
And I think that exact point does boil down to....
WHAT IS IT YOU WANT TO DO! :stuck_out_tongue:
ahh
Haha, that's the trickiest part of all of this :slightly_smiling_face:
well they said they'd be putting me in general training
if i was to get it
It took me about 4 different job changes to figure that out
see i love vfx
but each time I went for an interview, I was adamant on the role I wanted to take
but dont know much so im teaching myself more and more about it
That's totally fine, you'll always be learning
Have you watched The Expanse?
okay, so... for next week!
I started it but I need to pick it up again
thats where i fell in love
For next week, I want you to pick 3 different jobs you'd like to do in VFX. Write a little about each (a sentance or two, not much) and email it over to me
okay i shall
We can go through each one and figure out where your skills are
Just a bit weary of time, I have another meeting in 5 minutes
but I will watch the expanse. I need something to keep me busy in the evenings at the moment!
haha i get that
Out of interest, do you have any feedback for me? This is the first time I'm doing this for Access VFX. Is there anything you'd like to focus more on?
okay i shall
not that much your helps brilliant
speaking the truth
you're more than welcome
it's a difficult industry
but you will love it
i already do
im making my short for next year
based in Kenya
that sounds cool!
What are you shooting on? Do you know yet?
Also, do you have a budget?
not yet at the moment still in pre production
Next week, I should have more time
but were getting Lupita Nyong'o
as our main
so we can have a look at the some of the pre prod for that if you like too?
that would be brilliant
have a nice day Oliver!!
That sounds amazing too^
Okay cool!
You too, keep in touch
if you want to chat before hand, drop me an email first as I'm not always online with this
i shall
sweet, have a nice weekend
you too!
